I don't really try to make any big sayings on death - everyone grieves in their own way.
Saying to remember them, or anything like that, isn't usually very good.

My brother dedicates one day a week to his dead best mate - the day he discovered him in the flat.
He drinks whiskey in memory of his friend every Wednesday - it works for him dedicating one afternoon a week.

Personally, I try to live on - maybe think of what they and your would like to happen (ie, I wouldn't want anyone thinking of me too much after death).

Sorry to hear about your loss though (although I am unable to relate).
